Playground.Agents
Class Agent

java.lang.Object
  Playground.Agents.Agent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, AgentInterface, Walkable, BiDimensional
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProkaryotesAgent, Worm
public abstract class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
implements AgentInterface, java.lang.Runnable, Walkable

A Voluntary individual Bot, running in a 2D Playground, Having an Embryonic Intelligence Reacting with other Bots, and Object that seeks in its Playground. By voluntary is meant that each Agent has its own Intelligence to react Differently in any overcome situation. This Agent instance may have different kind of forms as its vital properties are parametric. Any kind of Agent-Form should inherit this class and change as wish. New Thread, Breathing and Acting with >1Hz An Agent class is formed as abstract as it may not be considered a life form in such general way. Additionally, this class should be inherit to provide Basic life form to each new AgentLife Being.

Author:
Pappas Evangelos - papas.evagelos@gmail.com - BagosGiAr

Nested Class Summary
 class Agent.AgentTimer
          A Class that makes Agent have its own Timer for Acting and calculating Is runnable in order to have Agent in a new lifeThread an run with no Dependency from other generated Agents
 class Agent.Chromosome
          As an Agent may Evolve and reproduct it self.
 class Agent.MoveAction
          A class that Calculates and perform Agent's Movements and position, it also shout for a new Movement

Agent

public Agent(java.lang.String name)
A Voluntary individual Bot, running in a 2D Playground, Having an Embryonic Intelligence Reacting with other Bots, and Object that seeks in its Playground. By voluntary is meant that each Agent has its own Intelligence to react Differently in any overcome situation. This Agent instance may have different kind of forms as its vital properties are parametric. Any kind of Agent-Form should inherit this class and change as wish. New Thread, Breathing and Acting with >1Hz An Agent class is formed as abstract as it may not be considered a life form in such general way. Additionally, this class should be inherit to provide Basic life form to each new AgentLife Being.

Parameters:
name - Agent's Name
See Also:
Agent(String, Playground, double, double), onBreathing(), onCreate()

act

public void act()
Agent Acts, Start Moving Randomly, Checking for Food, Communicates, eats, get Tired, get Hungry, and if it get very Tired -> Dies Actually this is an example scenario that can be overridden by a SubClass and build its own Scenario-Script.

it just gives true parameter and Do react with each noticeable objects.

public void seekNearObjects(boolean react)
Seek for Near Objects in current position.

Parameters:
react - False, the Agent Stay Still and doesn't react with the Objects

pause

public final void pause()
Deprecated. Use deactivate() instead

This How the Agent Pause its Heart beat without Diing. Though As the Agent has the right to prevent this, it may throw an exception in onDeactivating() method. Also Agent may not pause it timer because of some of agentTimer's exception.

deactivate

public final boolean deactivate()
This How the Agent Pause its Heart beat without Diing. Though As the Agent has the right to prevent this, it may throw an exception in onDeactivating() method. Also Agent may not pause it timer because of some of agentTimer's exception.

Returns:
true if it's paused
See Also:
onDeactivating(), reactivate(), #AgentTimer

unPause

public final void unPause()
Deprecated. Use reactivate() instead

This How the Agent unPaused its heart-beat and start running again. it AgentTimer start beating again and just before that the onRevive() method is being called. Thishow Agent has the freedom//Right to decide the Just-Before action it will do.

reactivate

public final boolean reactivate()
This How the Agent unPaused its heart-beat and start running again. it AgentTimer start beating again and just before that the onRevive() method is being called. Thishow Agent has the freedom//Right to decide the Just-Before action it will do.

Returns:
true if it's unPaused
See Also:
onRevive(), deactivate(), #AgentTimer

die

public final void die()
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                      Playground.Agents.AgentDeath
This, Kills Agent and stop its Task and lifeThread. it kills its lifeThread and also stop its Timer. Thishow an Agent is dead although the Agent is not deleted as the delete function should be implemented by a global Daemon which collects all non alive Agents in the agentHost. The Agent has the right to refuse his death. So a onDie event is taking place just before an AgentDeath Happen.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
AgentDeath
See Also:
onDie()
